Who we are

{/* */}

The SoCal Tanzanian Community is a group of people from Tanzania living in Southern California consciously collaborating on the basis of their belonging to the same country of origin. Collaboration could be through meetings and social events. SoCal Tanzanian community (Entity Number: C4564114) is a registered nonprofit membership organization, based in Southern California. Members are the heartbeat of the SoCal Tanzanian Community. The agreement of the Southern California Tanzanian Community entered by and between the SoCal and its members effective as of February 07-2020. Whereas the members formed the SoCal as a nonprofit Mutual benefit corporation under the laws of California.

Vision

{/* */}

The vision of the SoCal Tanzanian Community shall be: Striving to bring together Tanzanians, and friends of Tanzania, in southern California and beyond to actualize their full potential, activate their entrepreneurial spirit, and strategically mobilize financial and intellectual resources to ensure a brighter future for the community.

Mission

{/* */}

The Mission of the SoCal Tanzanian Community shall be to envision the SoCal Tanzanian community as a go-to resource, strategic friendship, and thought leader guiding and organizing social entrepreneurs, innovators, investors, and leaders in their ambitions to create positive change for the community.

Action Plan

{/* */}

There shall be three cardinal agendas which are Production, Empowerment, and Development. These three cardinal agendas shall be actualized by a team of SoCal Tanzanians whose responsibility shall be to re-engineer the community to satisfy the critical needs of its members and lay a solid foundation for future policies.

Production

{/* */}

The SoCal Tanzanian Community is a non-profit organization but will be managed in a manner where all members will have some form of succor for their investments (time and finance). The effort to create moderate revenue for recurrent expenditures through membership fees, donations, and contributions.

Empowerment

{/* */}

Human capacity building shall be the cornerstone of the community with the recycling of goods and materials from members and external sources to the needy, funerals, hospitals, etc…, when necessary. Members will be encouraged to be involved.

Development

{/* */}

The SoCal Tanzanian Community shall be well repositioned to take advantage of the latest social media networking tools to reach a wider audience to effectively bring change in relationship to the community to better humanity.

Community objectives

{/* */}

The main objectives of the SoCal Tanzanian community shall be:

  • 1. To create businesses and spur entrepreneurship
  • 2. To promote and enhance Tanzanians in southern California.
  • 3. Engage in economic, social, and cultural projects and activities that are of mutual benefit.
  • 4. To connect and unites Tanzanians in southern California.
  • 5. Helping others grieve.
  • 6. Support each other through good times and bad

The Powers

{/* */}

To achieve its objectives the SoCal Tanzanian community may:

  • 1. Raise money
  • 2. Open bank accounts
  • 3. Take out insurance
  • 4. Organize courses and events
  • 5. Work with other communities and exchange information
  • 6. Do anything lawful which will help it to fulfill its aims
